website_summaries.verdict: Those obsessed with keeping their workspace clean and tidy will find this under-desk headphone mount especially useful.
pros: Uses an extra-strong adhesive for a non-destructive mount
Unlike other headphone stands, this product allows you to store 2 headphones at once
cons: Adhesive may not work with certain types of surfaces, such as unfinished wood

customer_reviews.title: THIS THING IS TOUGH.
customer_reviews.text: The picture does not do it justice - THIS THING IS STURDY. I have two pairs of over-ear headphones on it (One for gaming, one for movies/tv shows), and this thing does not budge. I wasn't even able to get the tape to fit completely where it is placed (there's about 20% of it hanging off the edge of my desk) and it doesn't wiggle, doesn't peel or anything. The Anchor itself is made out of a tough but flexible plastic, and even with two cats constantly playing with it it refuses to fall down. It's placed basically right next to my computer chair and I bump it constantly - but it does not fall off. Can't recommend it enough.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Keeps falling off the bottom of the desk.
customer_reviews.text: For reference, I have a wood desk. I have cable management stuff and the like stuck to the bottom of the desk and they've never fallen. I put this on the bottom of my desk and put my headphones on it. Held up pretty well for a few days. Then the thing and my headphones just fell one day. Okay, fine. I put it back on and it held. Guess it was just a fluke. A day after it fell again. I then just put it, without headphones weighing down on it, back under my desk. It fell on its own this time. What the hell.

customer_reviews.title: Helps to declutter my desktop
customer_reviews.text: Since I've been working from home for that past three months thanks to Covid my desk at home has gotten a bit more cluttered than usual. I have several pairs of headphones I switch between depending on whether I'm on calls, listening to music, or if batteries are running out. I now have two of these hooked to the underside of my desk on either side. They keep my headphones off of the desk and out of my way when I'm not using them. They provide a great place to charge headphones. While my desk is not entirely decluttered it's at least much more under control now that the headphone situation is tucked away under desk.
customer_reviews.author: Bobmon

customer_reviews.title: Slowly deforms over years
customer_reviews.text: I first purchased my Anchor back in 2015, five years ago at the time of writing this review. At this point, my headphones fall off constantly because the rubber flexes downward too much. It was fine for many years, but at this point I need to replace it because my headphones keep fall onto the ground. Still, five years of use for something that costs so little isn't too bad.
customer_reviews.author: April King

customer_reviews.title: Great Hook!
customer_reviews.text: My headphones kept getting in my way on my desk. I remembered hearing about this hook and so decided to give it a try. The hook itself is very well made. They included some excellent instructions and provided all that was needed to clean the mounting spot for the adhesive. I did as instructed and cleaned the spot under my desk and then mounted it and gave it the requested time for the adhesive to cure. I absolutely love having this to hang my headphones on! It's such a simple thing but well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: D. Cormack

customer_reviews.title: Well made, fit for purpose, headphone mount
customer_reviews.text: I started to get a cluttered desk and needed to get organized. My headphones took up a lot of desk-space when not in use. This nifty little hook was an easy fix for that. It is well made and sturdy material with strong adhesive bond and clear instructions and tools to prep the future mounting area. I had not problem with affixing the hook at a good spot underneath my desk. two headphone sets have a new home - in reach but out of the way. Its been a few months now so the adhesive seems to do what it is supposed to do. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I had this for three years and it held up without a problem. I just now needed to remove it and it was tough job but I got it done using a heat gun and screw driver to pry it off. There was no damage to the desk. I wouldn't have cared if there were damage since it would be under the desk. Anyway it doesn't look like I can reuse this without getting more sticky stuff. That isn't a negative. I might just buy a new one. The construction and build are great. Highly recommend especially if you are sure you wont move it after being placed.
customer_reviews.author: BaronTop Contributor: Batman

customer_reviews.title: Decent headphone stand
customer_reviews.text: The adhesive is strong - make sure you have it aligned on the first try or your probably not going to get it off without a hair dryer. The product itself is made of a solid piece of sturdy rubber, which has some give to it so you can easily remove your headphones without damaging them or messing up the adhesive. Unfortunately the lip on the ends is a bit too shallow for my liking. I've knocked the headphones off a few times now. If your headphones have a thicker headband pad then I would probably recommend a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Lick it and stick it
customer_reviews.text: It's cheap. It hangs headphones. It sticks to things. 10/10 ****Update**** It no longer hangs headphones and sticks to things because it quite simply falls the %^*(^ off. After only a month or so. Skip this and go for a hard mount style hanger. As for this one I might drill a hole and then bolt it, but it premise of being super permanently sticky is flawed and not worth the $10.
customer_reviews.author: Ben A

customer_reviews.title: Excellent design and quality
customer_reviews.text: This is the epitome of simplistic design at its best. The design makes so much sense that it makes you wonder, why didn't I think of that? Couple that with the quality materials and you have a hit! I expect this thing to be stuck to my desk for eternity and unless I abuse it, I suspect it will fulfill its role for that long too. Just an all-around great product. If there is a con, I would say adding a metal core to the arms/hooks wouldn't be a bad idea for extended life. But again, I think if you use this properly it will likely outlive the user.
customer_reviews.author: Bill E.

customer_reviews.title: Great & out of the way
customer_reviews.text: I've got two headset hanging under my desk right now. For the longest time I had my headsets just taking up desk space, laying down. Recently I thought to perhaps get a desktop headphone stand. Ultimately I got this & am so happy I did. I lose none of my Desktop space, they're hidden out of the way. I placed my under my desk and about a foot to a foot & a 1/2 to my right hand side. Installation was super easy. I have a glass desk, to anyone interested.
customer_reviews.author: Gevin Huey

customer_reviews.title: Have 2 of these and plan to buy more
customer_reviews.text: Love this little headphone hanger. It saves desk space and its super easy to grab my headphones and place back. As far as strength, this thing isn't going anywhere. I have used them with heavy studio headphones and have 0 issues. I have no clue how you would actually take this off, to be honest - its that strong. So maybe that is a con, but I haven't explored. It is definitely possible this is permanent but its on the bottom of my desk and I am fine with it.
customer_reviews.author: BobBob

customer_reviews.title: Just works!
customer_reviews.text: I don't tend to write reviews, but man does this product just make me happy. I'm building a studio, and my desk was getting a bit cluttered exemplified in my headphones constantly falling off the table. I put this sucker underneath my table and wallah! No more snags! It's also super easy know exactly where each headphone is without looking. The adhesive is really good. I've given it a solid snag, and it's totally intact. Better yet, I'm on a glass table, so I can see exactly how well it's staying stuck underneath the table. I love when a product fulfills a need perfectly. Makes the price almost irrelevant because that problem disappears. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: no_name

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Great price.
customer_reviews.text: The package came in the bubble lined manila envelope with a box inside. The product feels nice to the touch with a soft rubber texture. I have it installed under my computer desk within arms reach. No tools/screws required to install, simply peel the double-sided 3M tape backing and place it where you want it. Be careful tho, the tape is VERY sticky, so plan accordingly as it will be hard to remove. So far I have my SteelSeries Arctis 3 hanging on it, and it does not look like its going anywhere. It is very stable and I feel like the hook can handle fairly hefty headphones. Over all satisfied with the product.
customer_reviews.author: 0h herrow

customer_reviews.title: Worked great at first
customer_reviews.text: Love this headphone anchor at first.... till after about a month I came home to find my Sennheiser HD6xx's and HiFiMan H-4XX's sitting on the floor. I had even used screws to secure the achnor but since it is made from a silicon material, the wood screws ended up going right through the predilled holes. These are probably fine for lightweight headphones but I certainly wouldn't recommend trusting this anchor to with audiophile quality headphones again. Luckily I just ended up with a small ding in the grill of my HD6xx's and no damage to the connectors.
customer_reviews.author: Adam E. Orcutt

customer_reviews.title: QUALITY PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS! Just what I was looking for! I am always dropping my headset on the floor because my desk does not accommodate much....I've replaced more headsets over the years, now I can just hang them up when not in use underneath my GLASS desk. I have a blood pressure monitor on the left of my monitor, and I can even hang the cord that attaches to the cuff so its off my desk too! The pleasures of a clear desk! I would recommend this product to everyone that uses headsets! I am thinking about purchasing one for the right side of my desk to stop the spaghetti wire syndrome! :)
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl L. Ketchum

customer_reviews.title: Works great  - nice way to conceal the headset when not in use.
customer_reviews.text: The product works. the adhesive is very good and worked the first time. They take care to tell you what to expect from the adhesive and what surfaces should be considered for the product so that you can plan where to put the product for best adhesion. Overall very pleased with the purchase. I bought 2 because I have two seperately connected headsets and mounted them on opposite ends of my office desk on the under-side of the desk-ends. This allows me to keep both the headset and most of the wiring off my desk top which was my goal.
customer_reviews.author: Roland & Mayra Beaucage

customer_reviews.title: If the description of the product at Amazon said the ...
customer_reviews.text: If the description of the product at Amazon said the adhesive works only on finished surfaces, I wouldn't have ordered it. The instructions says: "It will not hold to unfinished wood, particle board, MDF, or anything that feels fibrous." The underside of my work table is unfinished particle board, so I an thinking of returning it for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Recycled

customer_reviews.title: READ THIS AND YOU WILL WANT TO BUY THIS!
customer_reviews.text: Out of mind out of sight! I have my Sennheiser GSP 300s and my MPow bluetooth headsets both hanging on the Anchor and neither of them have fallen off. I was looking all over amazon for a headset stand but that would just take up space, the Anchor allows you to utilize every ounce of space you have. And to some people that means a lot when you arent working with a huge room or desk space. Its strong and durable and also cheap. This is the best headset holder/stand on the market that I have found. Highly satisfied and would DEFINITELY pusrchase this item again! Great job to the company producing the Anchor!
customer_reviews.author: Torres

customer_reviews.title: Very strong
customer_reviews.text: Have bought 2 they are great! I had one on my first desk and when I got a new desk I tried to take it off my old desk but that didn’t workout. The sticky tape is very strong and sturdy. When I finally got it off and looked at what I had I just decided ordering another would be the best option because I know it’s gonna last. Bottom line pick where you put it wisely because it’s not going anywhere
customer_reviews.author: TD

customer_reviews.title: simple, sturdy, and tidy
customer_reviews.text: it took me just a moment to apply the anchor to the bottom of my desk, leaving it to be cluttered by other items. the anchor itself is sturdy and manages to eaisily hold one pair of headphones on each side without any sign of strain on the adhesive sticker, which once pushed down is not going anywhere unless effort is made to remove it. warning! one time stick, so if you decide to move the anchor to another location then you will need to purchase another adhesive sticker, which can easily be found on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney M.

customer_reviews.title: Works as promised
customer_reviews.text: Happy with this item, this hook performs exactly as promised. Wouldn’t hesitate to purchase again UPDATE 4/25/20 Still attached to original spot, no issues. Functions same as the day it was purchased. ******************************* I rely heavily on reviews when I make purchases so I put some time into reviewing everything I buy on Amazon for personal or business use so I can help other people considering that item. If you found my review helpful, please consider hitting the "helpful" button below when it asks if the review is helpful!
customer_reviews.author: Mike303

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says it does.
customer_reviews.text: The product itself feels quite sturdy, it seems to be made from some heavy duty rubber material, don't quote me on that cause I'm not 100% sure that's just based on feel. The adhesive they use seems to be pretty strong. Once I applied it to where I wanted to put it I allowed it sit for maybe a minute or so and tugged on it and it didn't seem like it was going anywhere. It's a very nice way to discreetly hide you headset under your desk. All in all I like it and would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: UnholyV3nd3tta

customer_reviews.title: It works and is still sticking
customer_reviews.text: OK bought this to keep the headphones off the desk when not in use and was hesitant as its just stuck on with a double sided tape it comes with. So I installed it and wiped the bottom of the desk (wood surface) with the provided alcohol wipe and let it dry ~5 minutes. I then pulled the tape off the headphone mount and stuck it to the area I clean off. I waited ~10 minutes later as I wanted to make sure it was fully stuck to the wood. Sure enough the headphones are still there and nicely tucked under the desk when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: IdeaStormer

customer_reviews.title: Simple review for a product that works as intended with no dropping issues.
customer_reviews.text: This review is going to be short and simple. The anchor is easy to install and the adhesive is strong and holds. I use it to hold my Astro A50 when they're not charging and it does a great job and no worries of them just smashing to the ground. The anchor has a soft rubbery feel so you definitely won't have to worry about it scratching or scuffing your expensive headphones or headsets. Overall not much else to say besides if you're in the market for a way to store your headphones or headsets under your desk Elevation Labs Anchor is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Shiro Yusuno

customer_reviews.title: Feels very sturdy and well-made
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why I didn't get one of these sooner. I wear over-ear headphones at work a lot, and I usually just set them on my desk. Having a hook under the desk feels much better -- less clutter. Because I put this on my work desk, I didn't want it to really be permanent, so I first stuck it to a set of Command strips and let it cure overnight (as recommended), and then stuck the Command strips to the side of a metal drawer cabinet. The hooks are surprisingly soft and flexible, but overall it feels very sturdy and well-made. I want one at home, once I find a good place to put it!
customer_reviews.author: Tolana

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy hard rubber two pronged hooks
customer_reviews.text: These are two pronged hooks that adhere to a smooth surface. I have two, one for headphones which are being charged and one for headphones that ae already charged. The are made of hard rubber with a bottom surface covered in an adhesive. Once these babies are set, nothing is going to dislodge them. They work well for what I am using them for, but I am sure you could them for anything you needed to hang.
customer_reviews.author: G. Jorgensen

customer_reviews.title: Great Addition to Gaming Setup
customer_reviews.text: Allows for me to store my headphones when I am not gaming so I can work with a clear space. I recently purchased a different headset and this allows storage of both my wireless and wired headsets. Allowed the 24 hour cure time and it supports both headsets with no issue. The material is strong but soft enough that if I every hit it while crawling under the desk for any reason, it will not hurt. Perfect product.
customer_reviews.author: T. I. Youssef

customer_reviews.title: If U read it's manual, U can be satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: Some of buyers seemed to be dissatisfied with the adhesion and stiffness, and I bought after read these reviews already. However, after took the product, I read the install manual carefully, then I had known it was recommended to completely keep clean the counterpart substance before adhesion and the, to dry, and after adhere the Hanger then, not to hang the headset for a certain time period for copplete adhesion. So, I followed that manual. As a result, even with two high-end Heavy headsets for several months, has been mounted very stably. If you want ro purchase in the future, you can refer to it. I am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: It's the little things.
customer_reviews.text: I am surprised how much I like this. It seems like a small thing, but hanging my headphones under my desk eliminated a lot of irritation. It is a strong rubber. Stuff enough, but still a little flexible. The adhesive seems very strong. More than enough to hold up my headphones. I am very happy with the little device.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Cosino

customer_reviews.title: Perfect headphone storage solution!
customer_reviews.text: This goes great with my standing desk. I use headphones a lot these days for zoom, and it's nice to have a place to store them that doesn't take up desk space. It's great that I didn't have to drill holes into my desk to install this. Perfect solution for discreet but accessible headphone storage!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Kasberg

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: I just got some new dt770's and got this to keep em off the floor, desk, or my computer. I mounted it under my glass desk and it seems to be holding well with the dt770 and some older hd280's. I definitely recommend it, super convenient way of keeping your headphones out of the way and from getting stepped on or something spilled on them lol.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing little item - not much to say other than it works and works very well! Cleaned the area under my desk with an alcohol pad prior to installing. Pressed into place and left it overnight to seal. I have had two pairs of full size Bluetooth headphones on it hanging for over three weeks with no signs of failure. Looks great and has a nice finish to it, holds any of the many headphones I own, from small to large.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Great Mount - Works Exactly as Described!
customer_reviews.text: It really doesn't get much easier than simply stating this under-desk headphone mount works exactly as it's supposed to. I mounted mine under my IKEA desk and it's perfect. The mount uses super-adhesive 3M silicone adhesive. I've got a pair of Turtle Beach headphones handing from the mount and even wrapped the excess cabling around the mount stem to keep things looking tidy. The silicone materials used in the construction of the mount give just enough but keep your headphones securely in place. Really couldn't be happier with this product. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Raul G.Top Contributor: Lego

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: The Anchor does what the name describes. I hang my headset on it when I'm not podcasting and it is as secure as they come. It bonded to my wooden desk easily and will not budge. It has enough clearance to not stick out in my way even as my headset rests on it. I really like it and you can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Quincy

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous Product!!
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous Product. Well-designed, flexible, strong, and large enough to hold any of the headphones I own, and most any headphones you likely own as well. I stuck the Anchor on over a year ago, and the 3M glue is still holding strong. I currently have a pair of Audio-Technica ATH-M50x headphonesand a Logitech Bluetooth Headsethanging comfortably. Check out the included pics.
customer_reviews.author: WileyMan

customer_reviews.title: A must-have for desk organization
customer_reviews.text: After being sick of giving up desk real estate for my headphones, it was time for a change. That's where the Anchor comes in... a simple molded rubber hanger with powerful adhesive that sticks to the bottom of your desk (or wherever) to hang your headphones on. After cleaning the bottom side of the desk area where you want to stick it, you simply remove the adhesive covering, press and hold in place for about a minute, and voila, you have a headphone hanger. I currently hang a pair of giant Senty headphones, as well as a pair of smallish bluetooth headphones and the Anchor handles both individually or at the same time. Would totally buy again.
customer_reviews.author: CSkow

customer_reviews.title: Best to go with a desktop stand for your headphones
customer_reviews.text: Fell off after a couple of weeks. I had 2 lightweight cheap headphones hanging from it. After a couple of weeks it just slowly fell off and now can't get it to stick unless I go to the store and buy new sticky tape. I gave it 2 stars because it could be that I am in Florida in a hot humid environment. I am just going to get one of those nice desk stands for headphones. I think I saw one with a charger built into the base.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: My son started digital piano and he did not really have a good place for his headphones. He put them on top of the piano which looks very cluttered. I searched on Amazon and found this genius product!!! It holds up really well. I love it. It’s now under the piano and looks really clean. It’s also important to teach the kids to be a tidy person as well. They are even a local company in Oregon. Love supporting small business!
customer_reviews.author: Abbie

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it is supposed to with no hassle
customer_reviews.text: It came in a little bitty box with basically nothing but the product in it and that was all that was necessary apparently because this thing installs so easy that I did it by accident. Seriously, I stuck it under my desk after removing the protective layer and it just stuck there. Luckily I put it in a good spot. The adhesive is so strong that I could not get it off my desk panel to save my own life. 5/5, highly recommend. It is priced very well.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Henry Jones

customer_reviews.title: Wherever you stick it, it sticks there.
customer_reviews.text: The item is great. You put it under the desk, and it stays there. Problem is, you stick it under the desk, and it's basically a permanent fixture. Stick it under your dorm desk? You'll have to leave it under your dorm desk. Changing your IKEA desktop? This goes with it. It's a blessing and a curse. I guess I'll buy another one now.
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: Works well, even on particle board with super glue
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased about 4 of these so far. 2 were used on my old desk and 2 on my new desk. Make sure you clean the spot and let it set for 24 hours. It says not to use on particle board but you can if you apply super glue to the adhesive 3M tape to give it extra hold. It works really well, holding about 4-5 lbs. I even had it holding an Oculus VR headset for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Mounted the anchor below my desk to hold my ATH M50s and it works great. I usually hand my headphones on the anchor when they are in the bag (have a trash can beneath so don't want the cord to dangle at all). The 3M sticker is very strong and shows no sign of letting up. Also looks great and provides a way to store your headphones out of sight but not to far away. Much prefer this design to a headphone rack/stand that is put on top of desks.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Cirelli

customer_reviews.title: Great for keeping headset clutter organized.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing really to dislike about this thing. Super simple design. Super simple concept. Adhesive sticks really well... almost too well. As soon as you stick it, it’s stuck. So make sure your placement is exactly where and how you want it. Overall, it’s a great product. Works great. Use it for either hanging two headsets or a headset and the wiring.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred Marcelo

customer_reviews.title: Great for desk space management
customer_reviews.text: My main issue before purchasing this product was that my headset would be put in random places on my desk every day and take up valuable desk space. The only time it wasn't taking up space would be when in use, but I felt that it needed a place to be when its not in use, but I wasn't a fan of desk stands that would still take up space. The anchor was the solution and has been a great solution. Just make sure you know exactly where you want the anchor to be before you place it.
customer_reviews.author: Cytempest

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, great execution
customer_reviews.text: Nifty little hangar for your headphones, works well. Made out of a soft rubber material they won't damage the padding on the top of your headphones. Also grips the headphones perfectly so they can't slip off or hang unevenly. Very satisfied with the purchase but in retrospect I should've spent the extra $5 to get the bigger version with cable holders.
customer_reviews.author: Epillon

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended for heavy headsets!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately my headset is too heavy for this stand (they've hit the floor more than a few times), and I don't own a second set to counterbalance the weight. For lighter headsets I'm sure this would work just fine, but as it is the prongs aren't long or strong enough to deal with the ones I own. Other than that, it is a well made piece (it's quite solid despite being very flexible, and doesn't feel like it will come apart), and the adhesive has not bubbled, buckled, or released from the bottom of my desk despite frequent use. The concept is great, but the execution just doesn't work for what I have.
customer_reviews.author: Kieva

customer_reviews.title: Get organized by having a place to put your bulky headphone
customer_reviews.text: How wonderful to finally have a place to put my computer headphones so they are easy to access but out of the way. I had been putting them in a drawer but I was always worried that I would put something on top of them and mess them up. With this hanger the drawer is emptier, the headphones are always available, and I feel better about them not being damaged. Easy to install with the tape and seems to be very solid. Wish I would have gotten these earlier.
customer_reviews.author: William R. Vilberg

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Functional
customer_reviews.text: I've had this on my desk now for the better part of a week, and so far so good. I use one side of the hook for my headphones and the other side for the cords. I check the hook each day to see if there has been any kind of adhesion issues, but it doesn't appear to have moved at all. Like other reviewers have said, make sure to clean the surface that you're adhering it to thoroughly and let it setup for at least 24 hours before you hang anything on it.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant idea for headphones
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant idea for headphones. I had a pair of Sennheiser headphones that set on their own stand, but the stand was just one more thing on my desk. Then I bought a pair of Steelseries headphones, which came without any stand and so I bought a stand that sat on my desk which was plastic and bigger than the stand that came with the previous headphones, but it kept falling over. Then I saw this on Amazon and thought, "Perfect!" And they are. The headphones now hang on this bracket underneath my desk, out of the way when I don't need them, but within easy reach when I do need them.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Merriam

customer_reviews.title: Quick install, holds headphones well
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to get my headphones safely out of the way while not using them. This double-sided hook worked perfectly. Quick installation, iron-grip to the underside of my desk and a soft rubbery material that hold the headphones without scratching them.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Shank

customer_reviews.title: Great for small spots
customer_reviews.text: This thing sticks super strong! It holds both my sets of headphones perfectly. I put it up and out of the way because it fits in smaller spots. As long as there is room to hang your headphones on there after its placed, you're good to go!
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, works well
customer_reviews.text: Holding up a pair of Astro A40TRs quite well. No complaints at all. It's cool since where I have it mounted gets in the way if I have to stand up to open my window in my gaming room, it just bends over and snaps back, nice and soft so it doesn't rip into my thigh lol. Very robust silicone I think it is, holds up my decently heavy headset without sagging, but is soft and flexible enough to not kill my leg when I hit it. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Strong material and strong adhesive
customer_reviews.text: Adhesive is very strong - make sure you are certain about where you want it positioned on your desk because it adheres quickly and attempting to remove it after placing would potential ruin the adhesive strength Supports two pairs of over-the-ear headphones very well, I can pull on it with substantial force and the adhesive shows no sign of peeling off I use mine for a Corsair Void wireless headset and then a cable pair for audio monitoring as well - both quite bulky headsets. Awesome way to tuck them away yet keep them accessible. Hard rubber feels extremely durable
customer_reviews.author: robhallphotoTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Good space-saving headphone stand
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace the ghetto Rubbermaid makeshift headphone stand that I used to have on my desk because it was starting to take up too much space on the desk top itself. This stand lets me anchor up to two headphones at a time and lets me keep my desk a little more clear which makes me happy.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Stealth Install
customer_reviews.text: Love having my headphones within reach but off the desktop. This worked perfectly. Currently hanging Huge Sony Noice Cancelling Headphones and a gaming headset (two heavier sets), and this shows no sign of failing. I'm satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Ibrahim

customer_reviews.title: Just perfect for my setup
customer_reviews.text: I got this headset stand to be able to set my headset down in a nice sturdy, yet stylish position, and I just have it hanging off the top of my desk frame and it's just perfect, would recommend for those who don't want desk clutter.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Cazares

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphone Hanger
customer_reviews.text: This is a great alternative if you don't want to clutter your desk with a headphone stand. The mount is made of soft rubber and the adhesive back is very strong. One side holds my Sennheiser cans and the other takes up the slack from my 9-foot XLR cable. My headphones are always in reach when wanted yet completely out of the way when not needed. I'm glad I purchased this mount.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce N

customer_reviews.title: It's a lot nicer than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting a really cheap piece of plastic, but the thing that I got is nice and rubbery and looks really great attached to my desk. I'm using it to hang my dictation microphone, and it doesn't seem to be going anywhere. Feels pretty sturdy, and looks nice, so it's a good rec from me.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Sticky pad is too weak.
customer_reviews.text: The product looks and feels nice. However the sticky pad that attaches the hanger to my desk only lasted a couple months. I followed all the installation instructions to a T before using, and my Corsair gaming headset was still too much for this hanger. If my headphones were smaller, i.e. less-awesome, this probably would have worked out fine. Not great for holding anything more than an ounce or two in weight.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Hudgens

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts about the adhesion of this to an untreated wood surface, but so far it has held fast and sturdy. I use it below my desk for a pair of mixing headphones. Super useful way to keep them out of the way but close. I’ve even begun hanging a second pair on the other arm without problems. Happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: bookfiend

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite purchases.
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 pairs of headphones. Vmoda crossfade lp and Sennheiser hd598SE. I put this mount under my desk on my left side since that was most comfortable to me and then put both of these headphones under. It holds them both perfectly. They have never fallen off and the mount has never fallen off from under my desk. It keeps them nicely out of the way but easily accessible and I think it looks amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly Simple
customer_reviews.text: A perfectly simple under desk headphone mount. Made of a flexible, matte silicone, the mount flexes to allow for the easy hanging and removal of headphones, even when space is tight. The 3M adhesive holds tight, even to slightly porous surfaces such as a wood topped desk. Perfect for two pairs of headphones or one and their case. Love it as much as I love the other products from Elevation Lab.
customer_reviews.author: Jason W

customer_reviews.title: So simple it's stupid
customer_reviews.text: Never thought I would own enough headphones to become an issue, but I have 3 for my PC rigs and ran into storage difficulties. This device fastened under my desk and solved 2 of my problems. it's one of the little things that make life easier. get yourself one, or 2.
customer_reviews.author: JMac

customer_reviews.title: Just get one.. you won’t be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure why I waited this long to pick one up but I’m glad I did. This thing holds up well and is just overall a great way to clean up the desk. I’m very pleased. I decided to hang it on the wall because I primarily only have one headset, but you could hang it underneath a death and hang two headsets if you wanted too. This is made out of a nice soft rubber material. It feels well made. A+
customer_reviews.author: David Toro

customer_reviews.title: Great simple design
customer_reviews.text: The anchor is a great product even though it is simple. The only thing you may want to know about is the size of the hanger on this model. It is just under 1.75 inches which is slightly too small for both pairs of headphones I own, Sony MDR-7509 and Audio Technica M40x. This is not a big deal, but the headphones don't sit flat on the hanger because they are just a bit too wide. If that's an issue for you, check out the Anchor Pro.
customer_reviews.author: leitweight

customer_reviews.title: Works well, as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I mounted the Anchor under my desk - good design & materials. My only wish (what cost it a star, although really only a half-star) was that the ultra-adhesive 3M tape was pre-mounted. I would have preferred to use Command Hook refill strips so it could be relocated easily. That said, I probably could have replaced the adhesive before mounting. Also, my headsets are light; a gaming headset might require the extra adhesion. Summary - a simple, elegant design that works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce B.

customer_reviews.title: Smart design & purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is a great underdesk headphone holder! I love that it is a flexible rubber like material so it will never be a problem if you bang against it. Adhered great to the underside of my glass top motorized standing desk.
customer_reviews.author: KO

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: Was really impressed with this product. I honestly wasn't expecting much from it based on the price I just needed something simple that worked for the time being. I was blown away when I received the product. it is made of a harder rubber material which feels fantastic and it also makes it so the headphones don't slip. The adhesive is SUPER sticky as well. 10/10 would recommend I'm actually thinking about buying another one!
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Sheets

customer_reviews.title: Love these hooks! Make sure they're sold by ElevationLab and not someone else.
customer_reviews.text: Love these hooks, they've held up to constant use with some relatively heavy cans. I felt compelled to write a review to offset what may be some reviews on the inferior knock offs floating around. These were the real deal and are tough! Using the provided alcohol swabs to prep the surface, they've held up without a hint of letting go.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Enthusiast

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient
customer_reviews.text: Works for my needs. I didn’t use the sticker that came with it and instead opted for a Velcro/picture hanging command strip to make it easier to move if needed. Holds my headphones well and out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: MarinA

customer_reviews.title: Amazing at its job!
customer_reviews.text: I hang this underneath my workstation and it has been perfect eversince I got it. High qulaity materials and at a cheap price. It has space to hang up two sets of headphones but I use the other side to organize the lengthy cord of the headsets. Perfect solution for a cluttered desktop. Clean, discreet but looks great when you see it's function. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: The Toan Ranger

customer_reviews.title: Great product for multiple headphones
customer_reviews.text: I have two sets of pretty heavy headphones at my desk, usually swapping between the two depending on what i'm doing. I was a bit skeptical at first, seeing a few bad reviews, but went for it anyways. Just make sure you actually clean the surface before installation, it's been going strong for a few months now, with very heavy usage and weight put on it.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Holding my two favorite headphones, I am absolutely ecstatic and makes the ...
customer_reviews.text: Holding my two favorite headphones, I am absolutely ecstatic and makes the whole desk come together, being able to reach over and just pick up your headphones for either editing or playing games is an absolute convenience and you will love it when you install this, plus, the price is perfect. I like how it is able to be moved a bit and isn't rigid so you can grab your headphones without worrying its gonna bend an odd shape and break and plus its not metal. Don't get me wrong, but, having it be made out the material it is instead of metal or aluminum is pretty nice. Does exactly as it advertised.
customer_reviews.author: jim freeman

customer_reviews.title: Headphone hanging problems be gone!
customer_reviews.text: Tired of knocking your headphones off your desk? Annoyed with makeshift paper clip hangers failing you again and again? Well this anchor is the answer to your problems! Came exactly as described. Seems pretty durable and the 3m adhesive works like a charm. In fact, the 3m adhesive is so strong I'm not sure how I'll ever be able to remove it! A little pricey for what it is, but worth it in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: I like the slim design
customer_reviews.text: I like the slim design, but they just don't stay on my desk. I'm using a pretty standard Ikea desk and hanging a single pair of Logitech G35 and I've been through tons of adhesive strips over the year that I've owned this. Each strip only holds up for a couple of weeks before I find my headphones and the hook on the floor again. I've given up on re-hanging it and am looking for a different model. This probably would have been much better if they were screw mounted, but adhesives just aren't enough from my experience.
customer_reviews.author: sks

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, does what it says. A thing that I didn’t know until the package arrived is that it is made of some dort of softer rubber material and slightly bendable. No problem there, works all great and feels good.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Quality Piece
customer_reviews.text: I love my ElevationLab Anchor! It's such a handy dandy desk accessory I didnt know I needed! I'm recommending it to all my friends and family and its usefulness has already paid for its cost. Highly recommended and would purchase again if I needed another! A++!
customer_reviews.author: Derick B

customer_reviews.title: Excellent headset holder!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a new standing desk that did not have any built-in headset holder, so I found this and it works exactly like I wanted without being overly bulky like many of the other ones on Amazon are. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff

customer_reviews.title: SUPER strong
customer_reviews.text: This adhesive is STRONG. I hang my Bose Q35 headphones on one of the hooks and my steel Yeti water bottle on the other (often times full of water) and this thing doesn’t even bend. I have it affixed to the bottom of a standing LifeDesk if that matters to you. I’m buying a dozen of these to give as gifts. If you have a desk, buy one of these, you’ll be happy you did
customer_reviews.author: Roger J Pogoda

customer_reviews.title: Get this... if you don't mind it failing in 5 months
customer_reviews.text: 5 month review: The adhesive has failed and this product can no longer support the weight of my HyperX headset. I now own a double-hooked hunk of useless rubbery material. Anyone have suggestions for alternative uses? 1 month review: Works great! I have it stuck under my desk right next to my chair so when I'm ready to listen to music, game, whatever, I just reach down and grab my headphones. Clears up space on my desk and longer wires can be wrapped around the hooks to increase cable management.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Quality built, strong adhesive.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product! I've bought one for home and other for work. It's very sturdy and strong, with 3M adhesive, which they claim it's the same that is used by GoPro at it's equipment. The material is very nice. It uses a kind of quality rubber with soft touch that prevents it from damaging the headsets. It helped my to clear my work space. At work, I'm hanging two headsets underneath my desk: a Sennheiser 380 PRO (+modmic and cables) + a wireless Bose QuickComfort 35. At home, it's holding a Beyerdinamic 990 PRO Premium and it's long cable. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: MOREIRA P.

customer_reviews.title: BEST UNDER-DESK HEADPHONE STAND!
customer_reviews.text: I recently got this under desk headphone stand for my computer cause I cannot fit any headphone stand on the table of my computer cause my table is small, The under-desk headphone stand is very sturdy and can handle my headphones with ease especially with 2 and when theres one on one side it tips over a bit but still doesn't drop your headphones, I really like the under-desk stand cause it doesn't take that much space. I would love to recommend my friends to buy this if needed including customers who is interested to buy it you should, it's very good! Well Done Elevation Lab!
customer_reviews.author: Winston

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I have a motorized desk and this hook is perfect for hanging under my desk. Its nice and made of rubber so it bends a bit. The adhesive is a 3M adhesive so its going to stick. HOWEVER. that is the single complaint. I own TWO of these because I originally bought one and mounted it to the left side of my desk. But I moved and now I had to re-buy it again for the right side. The adhesive holds so well, I couldn't remove it!! Its not a knock per say because at least you know it wont ever fall off!
customer_reviews.author: cybah

customer_reviews.title: It was perfect for my table next to my recliner.
customer_reviews.text: This devise holds things like headphones , lamp wires , small flashlights , freeing up space on my table where remote controls , cups, or food may sit with no problem . I'm glade someone thought of this and developed it . Now It's mine ! I'll be ordering more soon to use on doors walls etc.
customer_reviews.author: s.frazier

customer_reviews.title: Great build quality
customer_reviews.text: I looked at all the tabletop headphone stands but couldn't bring myself to buy one. I really liked the idea of this being less obtrusive. I stuck it on the underside of my desk and it is out of the way. Yet, it feels very well made and solid. I was also impressed with the 3M adhesive tape used to affix this to the desk. While I wouldn't hang 100lbs off of it, for the purpose of hanging a couple pairs of headphones, it is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Just what I need!
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a headphone stand for a while. I considered the stand-up one, but worried about knocking it down or it will just collect more dust. This one is great. I placed it under our media table and it's holding up pretty well. Our table is glass which is probably why I'm not having the same issue of it coming off as other reviewers have noted. I'm guessing that they're sticking it under a wooden table that might have oil based stain and will therefore not adhere well to the surface. I'm happy with this for my Beats Solo3 and my old Bose quietcomfort 15.
customer_reviews.author: Loyal Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great on any surface
customer_reviews.text: This product works great in my home office. I was concerned about attaching the hook to the rough unfinished wood under my desk, but the 3M adhesive is firmly attached after a month of use. The hook is strong enough to hold both my wireless headset and a charging cable for days without moving. The hook itself is plenty strong to hold a wireless headset without bending, but the soft finish is gentle enough that it doesn't scratch the glossy plastic headset.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great headphone holder
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these, some at work, a couple under my desk, some on shelves. They make for a very handy way to hand headphones, cables, and any other little gadgets you want out of the way but within easy reach.
customer_reviews.author: Angry Bald Guy

customer_reviews.title: Not as strong as I'd hope for
customer_reviews.text: Looked awesome at first but quickly falls off. Stuck it and held it for a few minutes before leaving it alone for an hour hoping the adhesion would hold securely. Then i placed a pair of my headphones and half an hour later the thing just fell. Tried putting it back a couple times but at this point it falls without me even having to put anything on it.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased one for work and for home and find that it works well to store my headphones and call headset out of the way. The soft finish is nice and I do not worry about it damaging the bands on my headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: STRONG ADHESIVE - GOOD STUFF
customer_reviews.text: It's great! adhesive so good when I changed desk I just bought another one. The packaging is nice too! I would not worry about how strong this is. I use it with ATH DGX headphones that are pretty heavy. Holds them almost 24/7. Sometimes I even put a second pair on the other side (hyper x cloud 2). I love this thing and I will keep buying them. You should too!
customer_reviews.author: Hermundur

customer_reviews.title: Great for gaming headset
customer_reviews.text: I hang my gaming headset under my desk so I don't take up desk space. Efficient use of space but make sure you have a large enough desk so the headset does't rub up against your leg. Recommend to anyone looking for a place to securely leave your headset.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond

customer_reviews.title: It is a simple design. sturdy and good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Great product I bought a different cheap headstand, returned that and bought THIS quickly thereafter. This product is superior in all aspects to a headstand especially at the price point. You don't have to worry about it falling over anywhere. Its convenient adhesive lets you attach it portrait or landscape at your preference which is very convenient. It is a simple design. sturdy and good quality. I am not sure if you can re-attach it once its been originally placed. have not tried.
customer_reviews.author: JChung

customer_reviews.title: Functional & Space Saving
customer_reviews.text: I needed to store my headphones somewhere near my (small) desk but not on it because there is no room. This headphone mount is excellent. I mounted it under a shelf above my desk using some c-clamps and now my headphones are out of the way but within arms reach. Very happy with the product!
customer_reviews.author: Bryers Fam 3

customer_reviews.title: Adhesive holds what I hung. Using the screw holes looks like it would take some effort.
customer_reviews.text: Satin finish soft rubber. Upon examination it appears that attempting to use the screw holes would involve flexing the product to its limit to get anywhere near a straight angle with a driver. Thankfully the adhesive is adequate to hold even my heaviest headsets
customer_reviews.author: muhos

customer_reviews.title: Genuinely great product, feel lucky to have found it.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product, arms are nicely flexible but very strong, more than capable of holding headphones. Glue sticks well, but I followed the instructions so not surprised. Looks great. Bought two and considering more, not a huge amount of packaging which I appreciated. Arrived quickly and installed easily. 100% recommended.
customer_reviews.author: GratuitousQ

customer_reviews.title: Very strong and durable under constant use
customer_reviews.text: We use this product to hang up headphones underneath of keyboards in our piano studio. These have worked extremely well and they use a really strong adhesive. I’ve used other similar products but their adhesive came off within several days. This is a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Pretty darn perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Simple innovative product, such a quick and efficient way to solve a problem, simple to install, feels very high quality and has flex so you never feel like it's going to snap off. The ONLY reason is doesn't get that fifth star is because it feels like a very "one time use" product and I feel like it should come with precut 3mm tape for reinstallation. I mean you could always buy and cut your own tape but anything that keeps this quick and simple would always be better, perfect for its one time use but be sure you get it where you want it right the first time, there is no second.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Angier

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: These are probably the strongest hooks that I would trust putting my heavy headset on. I gave it four stars though because the stickiness isn't that strong and it actually came undone. What I did was put stronger double sided tape on it and that did the trick. My other gripe is since I only use one side for my headset, the hook is now slightly tilted from the weight that's only being distributed to one side. I'm wondering if this will get worse over time. Despite this, I ordered a second one because all other hooks don't look that great and this one is very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Charmmy

product_meta.title: The Anchor - THE ORIGINAL Under-Desk Headphone Stand Mount
product_meta.description:
The original under desk headphone mount 
Get rid of cord clutter on your desk and have easy access to your headphones with the Anchor. 
Mounts in seconds and holds ultra-strong. 
Flexible silicone construction protects your headphones and won't hurt if you ever bump it with you knee. 

Tip
If you ever need to remove the Anchor and it is holding too strong - just heat it up with a hair dryer and the adhesion will soften. 

Mounting Instructions
The 3M VHB (Very High Bond) adhesive will hold with over 40 pounds of adhesion to clean and finished surfaces. 
Important: It will not hold to unfinished wood, bare mdf, or if the surface feels fibrous. If the bottom of your desk isn't finished, we recommend either putting some finish on (polyurethane works well) or screwing it in. 
Make sure the surface is clean, dry, and oil free.
Firmly press the Anchor to yuor desk for the best adhesion.
It takes 24 hours for the adhesive to fully cure to max strength.

ElevationLab Guarantee
The Anchor, like all our products, is guaranteed for life to be defect-free. If you have any issues, please contact us so we can make it right.
feature_bullets: Keeps your headphones out of sight & easy to reach.
Thick premium silicone construction + steel pin inner reinforcement (new)
Can hold two sets of headphones.
